title: La Gazette de café du cycliste

elements.title: Ride & Create: Izu Ani.
elements.contents:
LA VIE

Ride & Create: Izu Ani. Izu Ani is a well-known chef on the Côte d'Azur, he has a habit of appearing at the Café du Cycliste in the port of Nice like magic. When he enters the place, he completely inhabits it with his energy and charisma, changing the atmosphere in an instant.

elements.title: Jérôme Cousin: From the Peloton to the Desert.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Jérôme Cousin: From the Peloton to the Desert. Less than a year ago, Jérôme Cousin was still a professional bike racer. He’s ridden in some of the world’s greatest races, including the Tour de France. Now, pedalling in the desert, riding a bike loaded with luggage, Jérôme’s only onlookers are the occasional farmer and his camels.

elements.title: Étienne Hubert: Paris by Night.
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Étienne Hubert: Paris by Night. Adventure is around every corner on a bike, even in Paris in winter. Olympic canoeist and Caravan member, Étienne Hubert, takes two kayaking veterans on a twilight tour of Paris.

elements.title: Introducing CDC GT.
elements.contents:
ROULER

Introducing CDC GT. Café du Cycliste’s first official racing team. Bringing together three dedicated riders, all hungry for big adventure on mixed terrain, the project will take them across the globe to experience the best of the world’s gravel competition.

elements.title: #WHATISGRAVEL - The Film.
elements.contents:
FILMS

#WHATISGRAVEL - The Film. Gravel is a playground with infinite possibilities. Gravel is being able to ride anywhere, any time. Gravel is a dizzying feeling. Gravel is constantly renewed wonder.

elements.title: Centifolia Lookbook SS22.
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

Centifolia Lookbook SS22. Created with local inspiration from Grasse, Provence’s perfume capital, Café du Cycliste’s new Centifolia collection is blooming with cultivated colour. Ride into summer smelling the flowers, and magically transport yourself to perfumed Provence.

elements.title: A Rose by Any Other Name.
elements.contents:
COLLECTIONS

A Rose by Any Other Name. A stone’s throw from the birthplace of Café du Cycliste, Grasse is the French capital of perfume and rose cultivation. The Centifolia is known as the Provence Rose, and is a gift from the land of the region.

elements.title: Guillaume Néry: Diving in at the Café.
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Guillaume Néry: Diving in at the Café. It took five magical minutes to understand the dimension of free-diving champion and Caravan member, Guillaume Néry. To watch him sit and hold his breath for five minutes was a drop in the ocean on the way to understanding what’s required in this super-human sport.

elements.title: Anton Krupicka: Farwell to Winter.
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Anton Krupicka: Farwell to Winter. It is said that the ride should be about the journey, not the destination. However, for Anton Krupicka and Hailey Moore, a recent trip in the Colorado mountains proved it’s about both.

elements.title: The Best Brasucade in the World.
elements.contents:
LA VIE

The Best Brasucade in the World. A meal at the end of exploring the Camargue, home to flamboyant flamingoes and brooding bulls. Fresh Mediterranean mussels from the local fishing port, with a sauce made of olive oil, herbs and Pastis.

elements.title: Ride & Create: Pierre Léopold.
elements.contents:
LA VIE

Ride & Create: Pierre Léopold. Pierre is a specialist in Drosophila, the fruit fly that is used to understand genetics. Outside the laboratory, cycling is for Pierre essential, and he explains to us that riding and research form a complementary whole.

elements.title: The Lozère: Hellhound on the Trail.
elements.contents:
ROULER

The Lozère: Hellhound on the Trail. Lozère in the Massif Central is typical of France Profonde. Connected by quiet and winding roads, there is very little traffic, a cyclist’s dream. One question, why is it so deserted?
